useCase.name: Item Drop
useCase.description: A UAV delivers an item such as a flotation device or defibrillator.

preconditions.precondition: The UAV is equipped with a carry-release mechanism based on either a parachute or a reel device.
The weight of the item to be delivered is within the safe operating payload of the UAV.
The item to be delivered has been attached to the UAV's carry mechanism.

successEndConditions.condition: The UAV successfully delivers the item to the assigned location.

failureEndConditions.condition: The UAV fails to deliver the device to the assigned location.
The UAV drops the item in an incorrect position or onto a person.

useCase.trigger: The UAV receives a command to deliver the item.

mainSequence.step: The UAV takes-off and flies to the designated delivery coordinates.
The video is displayed in the UI for a human operator.
The UAV uses image capture and analysis to determine a safe drop point appropriate for the task at hand.
The UAV positions itself at the targeted drop point.
The UAV requests permission from the human operator to drop the item.
The human operator gives permission for the drop.
The UAV lowers the item at the drop point.
The human operator confirms that the drop is completed.
The UAV moves to a safe observation point and awaits further instructions.

esteps.description: The carry mechanism fails to activate when commanded.
esteps.step: The operator attempts a manual command.
If the carry mechanism continues to fail, the operator recalls the UAV.

esteps.description: The UAV is unable to find a safe drop point in the vicinity of the coordinates.
esteps.step: The human operator uses the video stream to manually identify the drop point.

esteps.description: The operator refuses permission for the drop point proposed by the UAV.
esteps.step: The operator suggests an alternate drop position or aborts the drop.
